intro: Gomphichis adnata, commonly known as the slender bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Gomphichis adnata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a notable species in its native range.
